question.title: SELECT REF(...) works in SQL Developer but fails in SQL Developer VS Code Extension
question.body:
I'm using Oracle Database 19c

When I run the following query in SQL Developer, it works fine:

SELECT REF(p) FROM persons p;

However, when I run the same query using the Oracle SQL Developer VS Code extension, it throws an error and disconnects from the database.

Environment:

  • OS: Windows 11
  • Oracle Database: 19c
  • Java: HotSpot 64-Bit Server VM build 21.0.1+12-LTS-29
  • SQL Developer: Works
  • SQL Developer VS Code Extension: Fails

What I've Tried:

  • Reinstalling the extension
  • Testing other queries (they work fine)
  • Verifying object type definitions and table structure

Expected Behavior: The query should return references just like in SQL Developer.

Actual Behavior: It shows an error and disconnects from the DB session.

Question: Is this a known limitation of the VS Code extension, or am I missing something in the setup?

answers.body:
You're not supplying a test case, but assuming your SELECT calls a PL/SQL routine that returns a REFCURSOR, this is an known issue, BUG.

It's fixed for release 25.1, which is NOW available.
